sentences.english: We are in great need of Grade A.
Bridgehead bump is one of the urgent problems in the process of highway construction.
sentences.chinese: 桥头跳车是目前公路建设中急需解决的问题之一。

sentences.english: We need AB blood donors urgently because a patient's life is at stake.
sentences.chinese: 我们急需AB型捐血人，因为有一名病人的性命垂危。

sentences.english: Send me a wire if I am needed urgently.
sentences.chinese: 项急需我请给我发电报。

sentences.english: Cash-starved companies welcome Chinese investment or acquisition offers.
sentences.chinese: 急需资金的公司欢迎中国的投资或兼并提议。

sentences.english: In order to export their products, many companies are urgent to apply for product certification by the country concerned.
sentences.chinese: 为了出口，很多企业急需办理相关国家的产品认证。

sentences.english: Magnon needed two children; the Thenardiers had two.
sentences.chinese: 马侬姑娘急需两个孩子，德纳第妈妈恰有两个。

sentences.english: Of roots at the top and the much-scratched metal ferrule and spike at the base.
sentences.chinese: 根顶部和急需抓伤的金属箍和扣球的基础。

sentences.english: Uzbekistan is in urgent need of humanitarian aid from the international community.
sentences.chinese: 乌方急需国际社会提供人道物资援助。

sentences.english: I am in desperate need of help -- or I'll go crazy.
sentences.chinese: 我急需帮助，否则我会发疯。

sentences.english: Against this background, Inspur Communication needs to develop the company's development strategy.
sentences.chinese: 在此背景下，浪潮通信急需制定公司的发展战略。

sentences.english: High speed rail engineering developments need high efficiency welding.
sentences.chinese: 高速轨道工程建设急需钢轨高效化焊接技术。

sentences.english: Our school paper is in great need of an English editor.
But for now, the challenge is getting the virtualization on the hardware.
sentences.chinese: 不过，现在的急需解决的是硬件支持虚拟化。

sentences.english: However, in my most unhappy, when the much-needed comfort.
sentences.chinese: 可是在我最不开心的，急需安慰的时候。

sentences.english: The system badly needed reforming, Huhne said.

definition: very short of (food, clean water etc)/extreme shortage/deficit
lit. the fire burns one's eyebrows (idiom); fig. desperate situation/extreme emergency
to be deficient in sth/to be short of sth (supplies, money etc)
lit. pulling on the lapels exposes the elbows (idiom)/strapped for cash/unable to make ends meet
pressing in on one's eyelashes (idiom); imminent
to be in a state of emergency/to report an emergency/to ask for emergency assistance
to add hail to snow (idiom); one disaster on top of another/to make things worse in a bad situation
